ARABIC: وَمَا مِنْ غَآئِبَةٍ فِى ٱلسَّمَآءِ وَٱلْأَرْضِ إِلَّا فِى كِتَٰبٍ مُّبِينٍ

ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: Certainly there is no hidden thing in either heaven or earth which is not in a Clear Book.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: There is nothing of the hidden in the heavens and the earth that is not recorded in the luminous Book.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: There is nothing that is hidden - be it in the heaven or the earth - but is recorded in a Clear Book.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: All the secrets in heavens and earth are recorded in the illustrious Book.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: And all the hidden secrets of the heavens and the earth are (written) in a clear Book. (The Preserved Tablet)
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: And there is nothing hidden in the heaven and the earth but it is in a Clear Book.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: And there is nothing concealed in the heaven and the earth but it is in a clear book.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: And not a thing is there hidden in heaven and earth but it is in a Manifest Book.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: And there is nothing hidden in the heaven or the earth but it is in a clear Record.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: there is nothing hidden in heaven and on earth, but is recorded in a clear Book.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: And naught there is hidden in the heaven or the earth but it is in a Manifest Book.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: There is no invisible thing in the heaven and the earth but it is in a manifest Book.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: Nor is there aught of the unseen, in heaven or earth, but is (recorded) in a clear record.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: And there is nothing hidden in the heaven and the earth, but is in a Clear Book (i.e. Al-Lauh Al-Mahfuz).
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: There is not a thing hidden in the heaven and earth except that it is in a Clear Book.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: There is no mystery in the heaven and the earth, but it is in a Clear Book.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: And there is nothing concealed within the heaven and the earth except that it is in a clear Register.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [27:75] And there is not a thing hidden in the heaven and the earth (the hā’ [tā’ marbūta] of ghā’ibatun is hyperbole, in other words, anything that is completely hidden from people) but it is in a manifest Book, namely, [in] the Preserved Tablet (al-lawh al-mahfūz) and in God’s concealed knowledge, an example of which is the [time of the] chastising of the disbelievers.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: 433 (And there is nothing hidden) secret (in the heaven or the earth) from the inhabitants of the heavens and the earth (but it is in a clear Record) recorded in the Preserved or Guarded Tablet.
